title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 1211.80 - Articles referenced to this section
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 1211.80 - Articles referenced to this section

State Regulations
(a) Any article listed in section
1211.150
and referenced to this
section may or may not be a flammable liquid. When such article is not
identified by the prescribed D.O.T. caution label for flammable liquids, and is
known not to have a flash point, the article is allowed passage provided the
shipping order, bill of lading or other shipping paper shows the following
certification: "This shipment conforms to Port Authority of New York
and New Jersey rules for the transportation of explosives and other dangerous
articles via its tunnels, the G.W.B. Lower Level and G.W.B. Expressway."
or, when the article is not identified by the
prescribed D.O.T. caution label for flammable liquids, and is known to have a
flash point above 80 degrees Fahrenheit, it is allowed passage in containers of
55 gallons capacity, or less--provided the accompanying shipping paper shows
the notation "Flash Point above 80° F". (b) When such liquids have a flash point
above 95 degrees Fahrenheit, and are transported in tank vehicles or in
containers of more than 55 gallons capacity, they are permitted passage
provided the accompanying shipping papers bear the notation, "Flash Point above
95° F". Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
§
1211.80

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
